comments.content:
very close - so very very very, but no cigar.

—————  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Graphic Design, Melbourne](http://web.archive.org/web/20061201165827/http:/www.solid-creative.com/)

Paul, what differences do you see that make you think it isn’t Gotham? Try the test driver at [H&FJ](http://web.archive.org/web/20061201165827/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/gotham/testdriver/gotham_bold.html). (If it’s the apostrophe, well, designers have been known to substitute punctuation from other fonts. I’ve used apostrophes from Helvetica and Akzidenz Grotesk for that very purpose when the sans I was using had sterile, wedge-shaped quotes.)

the S and R seem just a tad off.

maybe I’ve just been looking at it too long - finding differences that aren’t there.

thanks

:)
